10 Artemis Statues = Less Lifehit on Errantries
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 2 Archive (PSOne): Raising/Training Methods: Methods That Don't Work: 10 Artemis Statues = Less Lifehit on Errantries
By BrimStone on Tuesday, May 20, 2003 - 12:44 am:

I wasn't sure where I should post this, but I couldn't find it anywhere else on the site. According to the information provided by Dark Phoenix and NeviStar, I believe that having 10 Artemis Statues in your inventory would shave 2 weeks off of the 6 week hit for errantries.

Lifespan index= Fatigue + (2 * Stress)
LI 71-105 = -1 week
LI 105-140 = -2 weeks
Errantry +18 fatigue, and +7 stress per week.
(Above info courtesy of NeviStar and DP)

Here's how I see it. Start off with fully rested and relaxed 0,0 monster.

0,0 (LI= 0) Always rest and item-up with whatever it takes to be "very well" the week prior to the errantry. I nut oil the beastie right before shipping him off, it seems to help.

week 1
18,7 (LI= 32) Statues= no effect
week 2
36,14 (LI= 64) Statues= -3 fatigue (33)
week 3
51,21 (LI= 93) Statues= -10 fatigue(41) -1 week
week 4
59,28 (LI= 105) statues= -10 fatigue(49) -1 week
"Bug hit"
59(49),28 (LI=105 OR 95) = -1 week

Correct me if I'm wrong, [and before too many people stuff their inventories with statues ;)] But is my math correct? Wouldn't the 'bug hit' be lessened by another week REGARDLESS of whether the statues worked before THAT hit? Oviously this is cutting it razor close with the LI=105, but I have little trouble getting my monsters rested fully b4 an errantry run (I am gonna get myself "12" Statues). Also, the statues would save you from even LARGER life hits, should your monster be slightly less than fully rested. So, it seems like its worth it, to me. I do love getting techs...

I'd also like to point out that the Gemini pot would do absolutely NOTHING during these 4 weeks, and hence has lost all value in my eyes, forever ;)

By BrimStone on Tuesday, May 20, 2003 - 06:48 am:

By BrimStone on Tuesday, May 27, 2003 - 04:25 pm:

Bummer! Turns out I was wrong! There's a first time for everything ;) Here is a table with the proper order of operations, assuming 18 statues!

WeekFtgStrLIStatueTabsItemAdjDrillLifeHit
128-13-56--13StrNO0,0Err[**]
218732---18,7Err[-1]
336-1464-3Ftg--33,14Err[-1]
451-2193-18Ftg--33,21Err[-1]-1
151-28107-18Ftg-13StrNO5,15**[-1]-2

By Kato Keeper on Wednesday, May 28, 2003 - 04:54 am:

Perhaps I'm missing something here, but the info I read on
Artemis statutes in this archive claimed they only work at
the beginning of the month

By BrimStone on Wednesday, May 28, 2003 - 07:46 am:

It is probably the chart's arrangement that is confusing. The first three column's are the stats at the end of the previous day, when they are checked for lifespan hits. The very first thing adjusted for after the LI check is statues, then tablets, then items then drills... Then the LI is checked at the end of the day for Lifespan hits.

I placed them at the beginning of the chart hoping to make the LI check clearer ;) I should have explained it a bit better, certainly.

By Kato Keeper on Wednesday, May 28, 2003 - 09:19 pm:

actually, the question I have is when does the statute effect
take place at the beginning of the month or every week?

By BrimStone on Thursday, May 29, 2003 - 05:55 am:

An excellent point! Not that it matters in this case, since even if it was a weekly effect, they'd still be worthless ;)

It seems I wasn't the only person who missed this detail, but DP and NeviStar DO say "beginning of each MONTH" and not WEEK. That's precisely why I posted, to allow this work to be scrutinized,verified, and/or falsified. Well done!
